definitions.definition: A European fresh-water cyprinoid fish of the genus Abramis, little valued as food. Several species are known.
A species in that genus, Abramis brama.
An American fresh-water fish, of various species of Lepomis and allied genera, which are also called sunfishes and pondfishes.
A marine sparoid fish of the genus Pagellus, and allied genera.
To clean (e.g. a ship's bottom of clinging shells, seaweed, etc.) by the application of fire and scraping.
(law enforcement) A long narrow pole-like club carried by police and security people, for use in self-defense.
A person who does not always vote for the same political party, but usually decides on the basis of policies.
To add color to.
definitions.example: The child colorized the drawing.

definitions.definition: To convert black and white media to color by digital post production (as is often done in digital photography and in video special effects).
definitions.example: There is a colorized version of Casablanca.

definitions.definition: To collapse or burst inward violently.
To compress (data) with a particular algorithm.
Of the second degree or rank.
A deep cooking vessel with a handle and sometimes a lid; used for boiling, stewing and making sauces.
A person who climbs mountains for sport or pleasure.
A person who lives in a mountainous area (often with the connotation that such people are outlaws or uncivilized).
An animal or plant that is native to a mountainous area.
To climb mountains; to climb using the techniques of a mountaineer.
To climb as if on a mountain.
An antelope of the species Damaliscus korrigum.
A taqiyah (skullcap worn by Muslims etc.)
The attribution of human characteristics and behavior to something not human.
The attribution of human characteristics to divine beings
One who reduces religion to strict interpretation of core or original texts.
A trader who trades on the financial fundamentals of the companies involved, as opposed to a chartist or technician.

Originally referred to an adherent of an American Christian movement that began as a response to the rejection of the accuracy of the Bible, the alleged deity of Christ, Christ's atonement for humanity, the virgin birth, and miracles.
A fundamentalist Christian.
Combination.
definitions.example: My old combi boiler broke down.

definitions.definition: A combination boiler.
An aircraft adapted to carry either cargo or passengers.
A minivan.
Either of two breeds of dog (the smooth fox terrier and the wire fox terrier) bred for fox hunting.
A complicated or clandestine plot or scheme intended to effect some purpose by secret artifice; conspiracy; stratagem.
The plot of a play, poem or romance; the series of complications in which a writer involves their imaginary characters.
Clandestine intercourse between persons; illicit intimacy; a liaison or affair.
To conceive or carry out a secret plan intended to harm; to form a plot or scheme.
To arouse the interest of; to fascinate.
To have clandestine or illicit intercourse.
To fill with artifice and duplicity; to complicate.
The rapid, uncontrollable descent of an aircraft in a steep spiral.
definitions.example: The loss of the third engine threw the plane into a tailspin.

definitions.definition: A severe mental or emotional collapse; emotional breakdown.
definitions.example: Just hours after leaving the institution, she suffered another tailspin.

definitions.definition: Any sharp, sustained, often uncontrollable descent or decline.
definitions.example: The present stock tailspin proves bankruptcy is imminent.

definitions.definition: Of an aircraft: to go into a rapid, uncontrollable descent in a steep spiral.
To go into a sharp, sustained, often uncontrollable descent or decline.
Based on experience as opposed to theoretical knowledge.
definitions.example: I have no idea why this works, but empirically, it works.

definitions.definition: Based on data gathered in the real world.
definitions.example: We need to test this idea empirically instead of just speculating about it.

definitions.definition: Bachelor party
A poster advertising a theatrical performance.
A program/programme/pamphlet for a theatrical performance.
A young servant or follower; a trained military attendant in service of a lord.
A minor nobleman with an honourable military rank who had served as a page and squire.
(by extension) An armored and mounted warrior of the Middle Ages.
definitions.example: King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table

definitions.definition: (modern) A person on whom a knighthood has been conferred by a monarch.
A brave, chivalrous and honorable man devoted to a noble cause or love interest.
A chess piece, often in the shape of a horse's head, that is moved two squares in one direction and one at right angles to that direction in a single move, leaping over any intervening pieces.
A playing card bearing the figure of a knight; the knave or jack.
Any of various nymphalid butterflies of the genus Ypthima.
(modern) A generic name for various mushrooms belonging to the fungal order gilled mushrooms; scientific name Tricholoma.
To confer knighthood upon.
definitions.example: The king knighted the young squire.

definitions.definition: To promote (a pawn) to a knight.
Having a disposition to do good.
definitions.example: Chinese and Eastern mythologies describe dragons as benevolent.

definitions.definition: Possessing or manifesting love for mankind.
Altruistic, charitable, good, just and fair.
A hook; a pot-hook.
A kind of weapon; a pike.
(in the plural) The draught-irons of a plough.
One of several species of marine gadoid fishes, of the genera Phycis, Merluccius, and allies.
A drying shed, as for unburned tile.
To loiter; to sneak.
An assimilatory process whereby a vowel is pronounced more like a following vocoid that is separated by one or more consonants.

The umlaut process (as above) that occurred historically in Germanic languages whereby back vowels became front vowels when followed by syllable containing a front vocoid (e.g. Germanic lūsiz > Old English lȳs(i) > Modern English lice).
A vowel so assimilated.
The diacritical mark ( ¨ ) placed over a vowel when it indicates a (rounded) front vowel
Diaeresis
definitions.example: Naïve takes an umlaut as it's pronounced as two syllables.

definitions.definition: To place an umlaut over (a vowel).
To modify (a word) so that an umlaut is required in it.
definitions.example: an umlauting vowel

definitions.definition: (by extension) Astonished or surprised.
definitions.example: The magician’s trick left the audience wide-eyed.

definitions.definition: A small ape of the family Hylobatidae with long limbs, which it uses to travel through rainforests by swinging from branch to branch.
The thin, horny, transparent plate covering the upper surface of the end of a toe.
To fasten two pieces of lumber together by applying nails or screws into both boards at an angle.
A cloth woven from silk, nylon or polyester with a glossy surface and a dull back. (The same weaving technique applied to cotton produces cloth termed sateen).
To make (paper, silver, etc.) smooth and glossy like satin.
Semigloss.
definitions.example: satin paint

definitions.definition: An elevated chair, often including a built-in tray, used for feeding babies and toddlers.
Any of several medium-sized wading birds belonging to the subfamily Vanellinae within family Charadriidae.
The tewit (Vanellus cristatus) (which is a type of lapwing in the first sense).
A silly man.
A person who has applied for asylum in a foreign country but has not yet been granted refugee status by that country.
Designed and equipped to be capable of sailing on an ocean.
Any natural phenomenon that causes great damage and loss of life.
The emergency situation that is the consequence of such an event.
The use or study of medicinal herbs
Botany, the study of plants in general
Conversion of one substance into another.
(in Roman Catholic dogma) The doctrine holding that the bread and wine of the Eucharist are transformed into the body and blood of Jesus.
Any of various deciduous trees of the genus Populus.
Wood from the poplar tree.
Naval military power
A country that has an effective military navy
A small edible European orange-pink lobster, Nephrops norvegicus

Describes a motor vehicle with the steering wheel on the left-hand side, designed for use in countries such as the Americas (with a few small exceptions), China and continental Europe where cars normally drive on the right side of the road.
(grammar) The grammatical mood expressing an order (see jussive). In English, the imperative form of a verb is the same as that of the bare infinitive.
definitions.example: The verbs in sentences like "Do it!" and "Say what you like!" are in the imperative.

definitions.definition: (grammar) A verb in imperative mood.
An essential action, a must: something which is imperative.
definitions.example: Visiting Berlin is an imperative.

definitions.definition: Essential; crucial; extremely important.
definitions.example: It is imperative that you come here right now.

definitions.definition: (grammar) Of, or relating to the imperative mood.
Having semantics that incorporates mutable variables.
Expressing a command; authoritatively or absolutely directive.
definitions.example: imperative orders

definitions.definition: To cover or enclose (something) by folding and securing a covering entirely around it.
definitions.example: He wrapped up the parcel with brown paper.

definitions.definition: To conclude or finish completely.
definitions.example: Let me wrap up this project before I begin a new one.

definitions.definition: To put on abundant clothing as protection from the weather; to bundle up.
definitions.example: It's a cold, snowy day and I'm going to wrap up thoroughly before I go sledding.

definitions.definition: To summarize or recapitulate.
definitions.example: The newscaster wrapped up the day's events.

definitions.definition: To tie up; to make too busy to respond.
A series of drawings that lay out the sequence of scenes in a film or series, especially an animated one.
definitions.example: The storyboard process helps promote brainstorming, highlights missing tasks, and allows the team to incorporate changes prior to traveling too far down a particular path. — By Cheryl A. Malloy & William Cooley, NASA & SAIC here

definitions.definition: Any sequence of drawings or diagrams which illustrate a sequence of events, e.g. in an accident or as a flowsheet for computer programming.
To create and arrange storyboard drawings.
definitions.example: Storyboarding allows students to work together as they generate ideas and eliminates the territorial defensiveness that often occurs when new ideas are suggested. — "Using Storyboarding to Determine components of Dellness for University Students" J Am Coll Health. 1996 Jan;44(4):180-3 Abstract

definitions.definition: A flat-bottomed craft able to float and drift on water, used for transport or as a waterborne platform.
definitions.example: An inflatable raft. A log raft.

definitions.definition: (by extension) Any flattish thing, usually wooden, used in a similar fashion.
A thick crowd of seabirds or sea mammals, particularly a group of penguins when in the water.
A collection of logs, fallen trees, etc. which obstructs navigation in a river.
(when ordering food) A slice of toast.
A square array of sensors forming part of a large telescope.
To convey on a raft.
To make into a raft.
To travel by raft.
To dock (toolbars, etc.) so that they share horizontal or vertical space.
A large (but unspecified) number, a lot.

One of the officials appointed by the pope in the Roman Catholic Church, ranking only below the pope and the patriarchs, constituting the special college which elects the pope. (See Wikipedia article on Catholic cardinals.)
Any of a genus of songbirds of the finch family, Cardinalis.
Any of various related passerine birds of the family Cardinalidae (See Wikipedia article on cardinals) and other similar birds that were once considered to be related.
(color) A deep red color, somewhat less vivid than scarlet, the traditional colour of a Catholic cardinal's cassock. (same as cardinal red)
Short for cardinal number, a number indicating quantity, or the size of a set (e.g., zero, one, two, three). (See Wikipedia article on Cardinal number.)
(grammar) Short for cardinal numeral, a word used to represent a cardinal number.
Short for cardinal flower (Lobelia cardinalis), a flowering plant.
Short for cardinal tetra (Paracheirodon axelrodi), a freshwater fish.
(bow) A woman's short cloak with a hood, originally made of scarlet cloth.
Mulled red wine.
Of fundamental importance; crucial, pivotal.
definitions.example: a cardinal rule

definitions.definition: Of or relating to the cardinal directions (north, south, east and west).
definitions.example: a cardinal mark

definitions.definition: Describing a "natural" number used to indicate quantity (e.g., zero, one, two, three), as opposed to an ordinal number indicating relative position.
Having a bright red color (from the color of a Catholic cardinal's cassock).
A rhythmically complex, often guitar-based style of experimental rock music that emerged in the late 1990s.
The first, and initially visible, page of a publication.
definitions.example: Congratulations, Dave, you made the front page.

definitions.definition: So important as to warrant being put on the front page of newspapers.
definitions.example: Amazing! This new revelation is front-page material!

definitions.definition: Which appears on the front page of a publication.
definitions.example: The new legislation was front-page news.

definitions.definition: Consequence
Of or pertaining to the ear.
Of or pertaining to sound.
Of or pertaining to an aura.
A decision in which neither choice is clearly favorable or unfavorable, or for which the outcome does not matter.
definitions.example: It's really a toss-up between the red skirt with blue stripes and the blue skirt with red stripes. They both look good and fit well.

definitions.definition: Either of two outcomes that are equally likely.
The toss of a coin used to decide some issue.
Something done, a deed.
definitions.example: an act of goodwill

definitions.definition: Actuality.
Something done once and for all, as distinguished from a work.
A product of a legislative body, a statute.
The process of doing something.
definitions.example: He was caught in the act of stealing.

definitions.definition: A formal or official record of something done.
A division of a theatrical performance.
definitions.example: The pivotal moment in the play was in the first scene of the second act.

definitions.definition: A performer or performers in a show.
definitions.example: Which act did you prefer? The soloist or the band?

definitions.definition: Any organized activity.
A display of behaviour.
A thesis maintained in public, in some English universities, by a candidate for a degree, or to show the proficiency of a student.
A display of behaviour meant to deceive.
definitions.example: to put on an act

definitions.definition: To do something.
definitions.example: If you don't act soon, you will be in trouble.

definitions.definition: To do (something); to perform.
To perform a theatrical role.
definitions.example: I started acting at the age of eleven in my local theatre.

definitions.definition: Of a play: to be acted out (well or badly).
To behave in a certain manner for an indefinite length of time.
definitions.example: A dog which acts aggressively is likely to bite.

definitions.definition: To convey an appearance of being.
definitions.example: He acted unconcerned so the others wouldn't worry.

definitions.definition: To do something that causes a change binding on the doer.
definitions.example: act on behalf of John

definitions.definition: (construed with on or upon) To have an effect (on).
definitions.example: Gravitational force acts on heavy bodies.

definitions.definition: To play (a role).
definitions.example: He's been acting Shakespearean leads since he was twelve.

definitions.definition: To feign.
definitions.example: He acted the angry parent, but was secretly amused.

definitions.definition: (construed with on or upon, of a group) To map via a homomorphism to a group of automorphisms (of).
definitions.example: This group acts on the circle, so it can't be left-orderable!

definitions.definition: To move to action; to actuate; to animate.
A free newspaper.
(paper industry) A sheet of paper that does not contain groundwood.
An employee (such as a secretary) who works in reception (receiving visitors and/or calls) for a person or business, especially an office.
A proponent of receptionism.
A cage to keep pet or zoological specimen birds in.
A game of chance played with dice; chuck-a-luck.
To give something color.
definitions.example: We could color the walls red.

definitions.definition: To apply colors to the areas within the boundaries of a line drawing using colored markers or crayons.
definitions.example: My kindergartener loves to color.

definitions.definition: (of a person or their face) To become red through increased blood flow.
definitions.example: Her face colored as she realized her mistake.

definitions.definition: To affect without completely changing.
definitions.example: That interpretation certainly colors my perception of the book.

definitions.definition: To attribute a quality to; to portray (as).
definitions.example: Color me confused.

definitions.definition: To assign colors to the vertices of a graph (or the regions of a map) so that no two vertices connected by an edge (regions sharing a border) have the same color.
definitions.example: Can this graph be 2-colored?

definitions.definition: An act or process which applies color.
Any substance used to give color.
definitions.example: Our cookies contain no artificial flavorings or colorings.

definitions.definition: The appearance as to color.
A disguise or discoloration.
An assignment of a color to each vertex of a graph such that no two vertices connected by an edge are given the same color.
The medium of radio communication.
definitions.example: Only about a hundred years ago, wireless was a new technology.

definitions.definition: Wireless connectivity to a computer network.
definitions.example: If your wireless stops working, try restarting the router.

definitions.definition: A radio set.
definitions.example: Let's switch on the wireless and listen to the news.

definitions.definition: To send a message by wireless (by radio)
Not having any wires.
Of or relating to communication without a wired connection, such as by radio waves.

One of the component parts of the corolla of a flower. It applies particularly, but not necessarily only, when the corolla consists of separate parts, that is when the petals are not connately fused. Petals are often brightly colored.
Term of endearment.
A means of passing through a wall or floor, having a hatch (especially on a ship); a doorway with a hatch rather than a door.
A small round fruit of a dark blue or red color of several plants in the related genera Vaccinium and Gaylussacia.
A shrub growing this fruit.
A small amount, as in the phrase huckleberry above a persimmon.
A person of little consequence.
The person one is looking for; the right person for the job.
definitions.example: I'm your huckleberry.

definitions.definition: To pick huckleberries.
Any of various polymeric resins containing urethane links; used in very many industrial and domestic applications.
The sound of a bird; any short high-pitched sound or whistle.
An entry posted on the microblogging service Twitter.
To make a short high-pitched sound, like that of certain birds.
To post an update to Twitter.
An onomatopoeic of bird singing.
The person who issues the call to prayer from one of the minarets of a mosque.
To set or compose written material into type
To be set or composed into type
(of text) Set in type.
A remedy to counteract the effects of poison (often followed by "against," "for," or "to").
definitions.example: She reached the hospital in time to receive the antidote for the snake venom.

definitions.definition: Something that counteracts or prevents something harmful.
definitions.example: We need an antidote for this misinformation.

definitions.definition: To counteract as an antidote.
In a federal manner.
A person holding a naval rank between rear admiral and admiral.
One of an ancient sect of physicians who went by general principles; opposed to the empiric.
Adhering only to principles which are true a priori, rather than truths based on evidence or deduction.
Pertaining to dogmas; doctrinal.
Asserting dogmas or beliefs in a superior or arrogant way; opinionated, dictatorial.
An extratropical storm, usually found in coastal New England and Atlantic Canada, whose winds usually come from the northeast.
A strong natural dislike or hatred; antipathy.
definitions.example: Their longstanding antagonism is manifested in frequent scuffles and shouting matches.

definitions.definition: A person who suffers from diabetes mellitus.
Of or pertaining to diabetes, especially diabetes mellitus.
Having diabetes, especially diabetes mellitus.
Suitable for one having diabetes mellitus.
A vase-shaped orange-fleshed hard winter squash, a cultivar of Cucurbita moschata.
One who keeps a diary.
Any of various frogs having a croak that resembles the bellow of a cow or bull.
A double-ended vessel, generally of stainless steel or other metal, one end of which typically measures 1 1/2 fluid ounces, the other typically 1 fluid ounce.
A measure of 1 1/2 fluid ounces of liquor.
A drink of whisky.
The sieve used in sorting or separating ore.
One who jigs; a miner who sorts or cleans ore by the process of jigging.
A horizontal lathe used in producing flatware.
A device used in the dyeing of cloth.
A pendulum rolling machine for slicking or graining leather.
A bicycle.
A golf club used to play low flying shots to the putting green from short distances.
A warehouse crane.
A light tackle, consisting of a double and single block and the fall, used for various purposes, as to increase the purchase on a topsail sheet in hauling it home; the watch tackle.
A jiggermast.
A small fishing vessel, rigged like a yawl.
A device used by fishermen to set their nets under the ice of frozen lakes.
One who dances jigs; an odd-looking person.
A short board or plank inserted into a tree for a person to stand on while cutting off higher branches.
A placeholder name for any small mechanical device.
A railway jigger, a small motorized or human powered vehicle used by railway workers to traverse railway tracks.
The bridge or rest for the cue in billiards.
An illicit electric shock device used to urge on a horse during a race.
A streetcar drawn by a single horse.
A kind of early electric cash register.
To alter or adjust, particularly in ways not originally intended.
definitions.example: You'll have to jigger it from the original specifications to get it to work.

definitions.definition: To use a jigger.
To move, send, or drive with a jerk; to jerk; also, to drive or send over with a jerk, as a golf ball.
A sandflea, Tunga penetrans, of the order Siphonaptera; chigoe.
A larva of any of several mites in the family Trombiculidae; chigger, harvest mite.
A prison; a jail cell.
An alleyway separating the backs of two rows of houses.
A penis.
A vagina.
A door.
An illegal distillery.
A lock pick.
To imprison.
To confound; to damn.
A player who plays in the infield, which is the inner portion of the field.
Having or displaying no guile, cunning, or deceit.
Free of artificiality; natural.
definitions.example: This pendant has artless charm.

definitions.definition: Lacking art, knowledge, or skill; uncultured and ignorant.
Poorly made or done; crude.
A brake in a vehicle, set by hand, and usually locking on until released by hand, enabling its use when parked.
The mechanism, particularly the locking hand-operated lever in a motor car, which is used to set and release such a brake.
To apply the handbrake in a vehicle.
A horizontal door in a floor or ceiling.
A trapdoor.
An opening in a wall at window height for the purpose of serving food or other items. A pass through.
definitions.example: The cook passed the dishes through the serving hatch.

definitions.definition: A small door in large mechanical structures and vehicles such as aircraft and spacecraft often provided for access for maintenance.
An opening through the deck of a ship or submarine
A gullet.
A frame or weir in a river, for catching fish.
A floodgate; a sluice gate.
A bedstead.
An opening into, or in search of, a mine.
To close with a hatch or hatches.
The act of hatching.
Development; disclosure; discovery.
(poultry) A group of birds that emerged from eggs at a specified time.
definitions.example: These pullets are from an April hatch.

definitions.definition: (often as mayfly hatch) The phenomenon, lasting 1–2 days, of large clouds of mayflies appearing in one location to mate, having reached maturity.
A birth, the birth records (in the newspaper) — compare the phrase "hatched, matched, and dispatched."
(of young animals) To emerge from an egg.
(of eggs) To break open when a young animal emerges from it.
To incubate eggs; to cause to hatch.
To devise.
To shade an area of (a drawing, diagram, etc.) with fine parallel lines, or with lines which cross each other (cross-hatch).
To cross; to spot; to stain; to steep.
A teacher of Hindu mysticism
Any of several rod-shaped bacteria, of the genus Salmonella, that cause food poisoning and other diseases
definitions.example: Everyone got sick from salmonella in the undercooked meat.

definitions.definition: Any of several acute infectious diseases of humans and domestic animals, caused by certain strains of the Vibrio cholerae bacterium through ingestion of contaminated water or food, usually marked by severe gastrointestinal symptoms such as diarrhea, abdominal cramps, nausea, vomiting, and dehydration.
The main part of the (human) body that extends from the neck to the groin, excluding the head and limbs.
Any of several red or yellow ants that can inflict a harsh sting.
A lively dance originating in Bohemia.
The music for this dance.
A polka jacket.
To dance the polka.

A valved brass instrument, a sax horn, the tenor of the tuba family of instruments, having the appearance very similar to that of a tuba. It is similar to and often used instead of a "Baritone" horn. (A true Baritone has a cylindrical tubing, while the Euphonium tubing is conical, though they both cover the same range of tones. This relationship is also between the Trumpet [cylindrical] and Cornet [conical] respectively.)
A witty remark; a witticism; a bon mot.
A word or a motto; a device.
A note or brief strain on a bugle.
A woman; a wife.
A prostitute.
A landlady.
Any of the usually 52 rectangular pieces of card used to play numerous games, featuring either one to 10 pips or a picture and belonging of one of four suits.
A soft jelly lolly, usually brightly coloured and fruit flavoured.
A person with a tendency to having allergies; a person with multiple or severe allergies.
Of or pertaining to allergy.
Having an allergy.
definitions.example: I am allergic to cats.

definitions.definition: Excessively sensitive; susceptible.
Quick to change one’s opinion or allegiance; insincere; not loyal or reliable.
Changeable.
To deceive, flatter.
To puzzle, perplex, nonplus.
